p.s: Description of Anoxybacillus flavithermus sp. nov.
Anoxybacillus flavithermus (fla.vi.ther'mus. L. adj. flavus yellow; Gr. adj. thermos warm; N.L. adj. flavithermus to indicate a yellow thermophilic organism)
Data are from Heinen et al. (1982), Claus & Berkeley (1986), Sharp et al. (1992), Rainey et al. (1994) and this study.
Glucose, mannose, maltose, sucrose, arabinose, rhamnose and sorbitol utilized.
Positive for acetoin, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, tryptophan deaminase and β-galactosidase.
Urease, ornithine decarboxylase, indole and H#S not produced.
Growth in 2.5% NaCl broth, but not in 3% NaCl.
Temperature range for growth 30-72°C; optimum growth at 60°C (aerobic) and 65°C (anaerobic).
Source: hot spring, New Zealand.DNAG­C content of 41.6 mol% (by HPLC method).
